column2: A Three-Tiered Evaluation Approach for
column3: page=0 xpos=1 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-largest page-top headchar-capital above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Interactive Spoken Dialogue Systems
column3: page=0 xpos=1 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-largest indented-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Kathleen Stibler and James Denny
column3: page=0 xpos=3 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-largest indented-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital above-line-space

column3: page=0 xpos=3 ypos=1 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-largest hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space symbol-atmark column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: ABSTRACT
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent font-largest column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: We describe a three-tiered approach for evaluation of spoken
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: dialogue systems. The three tiers measure user satisfaction,
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: system support of mission success and component performance.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: We describe our use of this approach in numerous fielded user
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: studies conducted with the U.S. military.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Keywords
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space string-keyword headchar-capital

column2: Evaluation, spoken language system, spoken dialogue system
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 1. INTRODUCTION
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space itemization

column2: Evaluation of spoken language systems is complicated by the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: need to balance distinct goals. For collaboration with others
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: in the speech technology community, metrics must be generic
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: enough for comparison to analogous systems. For project man-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: agement and business purposes, metrics must be specific
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: enough to demonstrate end-user utility and improvement over
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: other approaches to a problem.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Since 1998, we have developed a spoken language dialogue
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space year headchar-capital

column2: technology called Listen-Communicate-Show (LCS) and
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: applied it to demonstration systems for U.S. Marines logistics,
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: U.S. Army test data collection, and commercial travel reserva-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tions. Our focus is the transition of spoken dialogue technol-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ogy to military operations. We support military users in a wide
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: range of tasks under diverse conditions. Therefore, our defini-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion of success for LCS is operational success. It must reflect
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the real world success of our military users in performing their
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tasks. In addition, for our systems to be considered successful,
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: they must be widely usable and easy for all users to operate
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with minimal training. Our evaluation methodology must
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: model these objectives.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: With these goals in mind, we have developed a three-tier
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: metric system for evaluating spoken language system effective-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ness. The three tiers measure (1) user satisfaction, (2) system
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: support of mission success and (3) component performance.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period column-bottom

column2: 2. THE THREE-TIERED APPROACH
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-indent font-largest column-top itemization

column2: Our three-tier metric scheme evaluates multiple aspects of LCS
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: system effectiveness. User satisfaction is a set of subjective
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: measures that introduces user perceptions into the assessment
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of the system. System support of mission success measures
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: overall system performance with respect to our definition of
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: success. Component performance scores the individual sys-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tem component√ïs role in overall system success.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Collection of user input is essential in evaluation for two rea-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: sons. First, it is necessary to consider user perspective during
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: evaluation to achieve a better understanding of user needs.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Second, user preference can influence interpretation of success
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: measurements of mission success and component performance.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Mission success and component performance are often tradeoffs,
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: with inefficient systems producing higher scores of success.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Since some users are willing to overlook efficiency for guaran-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: teed performance while others opt for efficiency, our collection
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of user input helps determine the relative importance of these
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: aspects.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Mission success is difficult to quantify because it is defined
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: differently by users with different needs. Therefore, it is essen-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tial to establish a definition of mission success early in the
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: evaluation process. For our applications, we derive this defini-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion from domain knowledge acquisition with potential users.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: It is important to evaluate components individually since com-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ponent evaluations reveal distinctive component flaws. These
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: flaws can negatively impact mission success because catas-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: trophic failure of a component can prevent the completion of
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tasks. For example, in the Marine logistics domain, if the
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: system fails to recognize the user signing onto the radio net-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: work, it will ignore all subsequent utterances until the user
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: successfully logs on. If the recognition of sign-on completely
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: fails, then no tasks can be completed. In addition, periodic
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: evaluation of component performance focuses attention o n
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: difficult problems and possible solutions to these problems
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower
page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3. EVALUATION METRICS
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space itemization

column2: At the top level of our approach, measurements of overall user
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: satisfaction are derived from a collection of user reactions on a
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Likert-scaled questionnaire. The questions are associated with
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: eight user satisfaction metrics: ease of use, system response,
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: system understanding, user expertise, task ease, response time,
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: expected behavior and future use. We have categorized our user
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: satisfaction questions in terms of specific metrics as per the
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: PARADISE methodology [5, 2]. These metrics are detailed i n
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: Table 1.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail string-table headchar-capital tailchar-period page-bottom

column2: Table 1. User Satisfaction metrics
column3: page=1 xpos=3 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smaller page-top string-table headchar-capital

column2: __Table 1__
column3: page=1 xpos=-1 ypos=0 single-column left-over box hanged-line longer-tail table-area above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The middle tier metrics measure the ability of users t o
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 single-column right-indent shorter-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: successfully complete their domain tasks in a timely manner.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 single-column right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period column-bottom

column2: Success, in this case, is defined as completion of a task and
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified column-top headchar-capital

column2: segments of the task utilizing the information supplied by the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: user. A task is considered successful if the system was able t o
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: comprehend and process the user√ïs request correctly. It i s
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: important to determine if success was achieved and at what
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: cost. The user√ïs ability to make a request in a reasonable
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: amount of time with little repetition is also significant. The
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: mission success metrics fall under nine categories: task com-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: pletion, task complexity, dialogue complexity, task efficiency,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: dialogue efficiency, task pace, dialogue pace, user frustration
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and intervention rate.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: For these metrics, we consider the tasks the user is trying t o
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: accomplish and the dialogue in which the user has with the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: system to accomplish those tasks. A session is a continuous
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: period of user interaction with the spoken dialogue system. A
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column centered aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: session can be examined from two perspectives, task and dia-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: logue, as shown in Figure 1. Segments are atomic operations
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: performed within a task. The success rate of each segment is an
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: important part of the analysis of the system, while the success
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: rate of each task is essential for the comprehensive evaluation
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of the system. For example, a task of ordering supplies in the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Marine logistics domain includes segments of signing onto the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: radio network, starting the request form, filling in items a
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: through h, submitting the form and signing off the network.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Each segment receives an individual score of successfully
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: completion. The Task Completion metric consists of success
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: scores for the overall task and the segments of the task.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Dialogue is the collection of utterances spoken to accomplish
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: the given task. It is necessary to evaluate Dialogue Efficiency
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to achieve an understanding of how complex the user√ïs dia-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: logue is for the associated task. A turn is one user utterance, a
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: step in accomplishing the task through dialogue. Concepts are
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: atomic bits of information conveyed in a dialogue. For example,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: if the user√ïs utterance consists of delivery time and delivery
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: location for a particular Marine logistic request, the time and
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: location are the concepts of that turn. These metrics are
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: described in greater detail in Table 2.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period column-bottom

column2: Session
column3: page=1 xpos=6 ypos=3 right-column left-indent right-indent column-top headchar-capital above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Task Dialogue
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column left-indent right-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Segment Turn

column2: Concept Word

column2: Figure 1. Structural Hierarchy of a Spoken Dialogue
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smaller hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space string-figure headchar-capital

column3: page=1 xpos=7 ypos=7 right-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smaller indented-line shorter-tail headchar-capital above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The lowest level tier measures the effectiveness of individual
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: system components along specific dimensions, including com-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ponent error rates. Overall system level success is determined
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: by how well each component accomplishes its responsibility.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: This concerns measurements such as word accuracy, utterance
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: accuracy, concept accuracy, component speed, processing
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: errors, and language errors. These measurements aid system
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: developers by emphasizing component weakness. Component
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Performance metrics also offer explanations for others metrics.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-period

column2: For example, bottlenecks within a component may be respon-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: sible for slow system response time. Another example i s
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: concerned with recognition accuracy. Poor word accuracy may
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: account for low scores of task completion and user satisfaction
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with the system.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period page-bottom

column2: Table 2. Mission metrics
column3: page=2 xpos=3 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smaller page-top string-table headchar-capital

column2: __Table 2__

column2: Some component performance metrics rely upon measurements
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified column-top line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: from multiple components. For example, Processing Errors
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: combines data transfer errors, logic errors, and agent errors.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Those measurements map to the Turn Manager which controls
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: the system's dialogue logic, the Mobile Agents which interface
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with data sources, and the Hub which coordinates component
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: communication. The metrics are discussed in Table 3.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 4. EVALUATION PROCESS
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space itemization

column2: Our LCS systems are built upon MIT√ïs Galaxy II architecture
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: [3]. Galaxy II is a distributed, plug and play component-based
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: architecture in which specialized servers handle specific tasks,
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: such as translating audio data to text, that communicate
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: through a central server (Hub). The LCS system shown i n
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Figure 2 includes servers for speech recording and playback
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line string-figure headchar-capital

column2: (Audio I/O), speech synthesis (Synthesis), speech recognition
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: (Recognizer), natural language processing (NL), discourse/
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line column-bottom

column2: response logic (Turn Manager), and an agent server (Mobile
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower

column2: Agents) for application/database interaction.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: We implement a number of diverse applications and serve a
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: user population that has varying expertise. The combination of
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: these two factors result in a wide range of expectations of
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: system performance by users. We have found that the three-tier
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: system and related evaluation process not only capture those
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: expectations, but also aid in furthering our development.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Our evaluation process begins with conducting a user study,
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: typically in the field. We refer to these studies as Integrated
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Feasibility Experiments (IFE). Participants involved in the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: IFEs are trained to use their particular LCS application by a
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: member of our development team. The training usually takes 1 5
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to 30 minutes. The training specifies the purpose of the LCS
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: application in aiding their work, includes a brief description of
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the LCS architecture, and details the speech commands and
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Table 3. Component metrics
column3: page=2 xpos=3 ypos=9 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smaller column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital above-line-space

column2: __Table 3__
column3: page=2 xpos=-1 ypos=10 single-column left-over box hanged-line longer-tail line-space table-area page-bottom

column2: __Figure 2__
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=-1 left-column left-indent right-indent box page-top figure-area above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Figure 2. LCS architecture
column3: page=3 xpos=1 ypos=2 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smaller indented-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space string-figure headchar-capital above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: expected responses through demonstration. After the intro-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ductory instruction and demonstration, participants practice
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: interacting with the system.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: For each study, we develop a set of scenarios based upon our
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: knowledge of the domain and ask each participant to complete
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the scenarios as quickly as they can with maximal accuracy and
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: minimal moderator assistance. The study usually consists of
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: approximately five task scenarios of varying difficulty. The
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: scenarios are carried out in fixed order and are given a time
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: limit, generally no longer than 30 minutes. The system logs
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: key events at the Hub, including times and values for the
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: user√ïs speech recording, recognition hypotheses, grammatical
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: parse, resultant query, component speeds, any internal errors,
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: and the system√ïs response. In addition, the moderator notes
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: any assistance or intervention, such as reminding the user of
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: proper usage or fixing an application error. Once the tasks are
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: completed, the user fills out a web-based survey and partici-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: pates in a brief interview. These determine user satisfaction
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with the system.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Upon conclusion of a user study, we extract the log files and
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: code the users√ï recordings through manual transcription. We
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: add diagnostic tags to the log files, noting such events as
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: rephrased utterances and causes of errors and then audit all of
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the logs for accuracy and consistency. Some of the diagnostic
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tags that we annotate are number of items and concepts within
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: an utterance, frame construction errors, repeated or rephrased
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: utterances and deficiencies of the training sentence corpus.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: This is a very time consuming process. Therefore, it is nec-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: essary to involve multiple people in this phase of the
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: evaluation. However, one individual is tasked with the final
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: responsibility of examining the annotations for consistency.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: A series of scripts and spreadsheets calculate our metrics from
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: the log files. These scripts take the log files as parameters and
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: produce various metric values. While interpreting the metrics
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: values, we may re-examine the log files for an exploration of
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: detail related to particular tasks or events in order t o
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: understand any significant and surprising results or trends.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Finally, through a mixture of automated formatting and manual
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: commentary, we create a summary presentation of the user study
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: results. Web pages are generated that contain some of the
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: metrics collected throughout the study.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period column-bottom

column2: 5. APPROACH VERIFICATION
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent font-largest column-top itemization

column2: We have applied our approach in four separate IFEs to date. In
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: each case, our metrics revealed areas for improvement. As these
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: improvements were made, the problems discovered in the next
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: IFE were more subtle and deeply ingrained within the system.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-period

column2: Mission success and component metrics aided in the interpre-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tation of user perception and drove future system development.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: A top-level summary of IFEs, metrics and system improvements
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: is described.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The first IFE was our pilot study, which took place in-house i n
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: September 1999. Five subjects with varying military experi-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ence were asked to complete three tasks, which were scripted
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: for them. The tier one metrics revealed the users√ï dissatisfaction
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with the system responses and the time required in receiving
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: them. These perceptions led to system changes within our
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Agent and Turn Manager structures that improved the speed of
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: our database agents and more appropriate responses from the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: LCS system.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The second IFE took place during the Desert Knight 1999
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space year headchar-capital

column2: Marine exercise at Twentynine Palms, CA in December 1999.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital tailchar-period

column2: Ten subjects, each an active duty Marine with varying radio
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: operator experience, were given five tasks. This user study
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: offered the subjects the option of following scripts in their
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tasks. The metrics of tier one showed an increase in overall user
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: satisfaction and revealed the users√ï difficulty using the system
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and anticipating its behavior. These concerns influenced future
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: user training and the development of more explicit system
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: responses.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The third IFE occurred during the Marine CAX 6 (Combined
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: Arms Exercise) at Twentynine Palms, CA in April 2000. The
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital

column2: seven subjects were active duty Marines, some with minimal
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: radio training. They were required to complete five tasks that
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: had scenario-based, non-scripted dialogues. A combination of
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tier one, tier two and tier three metrics exposed a deficiency i n
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the speech recognition server, prompting us to increase
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: recognizer training for subsequent IFEs. A recognizer training
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: corpus builder was developed to boost recognition scores.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The most recent IFE was conducted in Gulfport, MS during the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: August 2000 Millennium Dragon Marine exercise. Six active
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital

column2: duty Marines with varied radio experience completed five
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: scenario-based tasks. This time the users expressed concern
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with system understanding and ease of use through the tier one
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: metrics. The tier three metrics revealed an error in our natural
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: language module, which sometimes had been selecting the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: incorrect user utterance from recognizer output. This error has
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: since been removed from the system.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The three-tiered approach organizes analysis of the inter-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: dependence among metrics. It is useful to study the impact of a
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: metric in one tier against metrics in another tier through
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: principal component analysis. These statistics do not neces-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sarily evidence causality, of course, but they do suggest
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: insightful correlation. This insight exposes the relative signifi-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cance of various factors' contribution to particular assessments
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of mission success or user satisfaction.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 6. FUTURE ENHANCEMENTS
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space itemization

column2: Although this three-tier evaluation process provides useful
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: metrics, we have identified three improvements that we plan t o
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: incorporate into our process: (1) an annotation aide, (2) com-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: munity standardization, and (3) increased automation. The
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower page-bottom

column2: annotation aide would allow multiple annotators to review
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified page-top headchar-lower

column2: and edit logs independently. With this tool, we could autom-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: atically measure and control cross-annotator consistency,
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: currently a labor-intensive chore. Community standardization
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: entails a logging format, an annotation standard, and calcula-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion tools common to the DARPA Communicator project [4],
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: several of which have been developed, but we are still working
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to incorporate them. The advantage of community standardiza-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion is the benefit from tools developed by peer organizations
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and the ability to compare results. Accomplishing the first two
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: improvements largely leads to the third improvement, increased
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: automation, because most (if not all) aspects from measurement
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: through annotation to calculation then have a controlled
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: format and assistive tools. These planned improvements will
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: make our evaluation process more reliable and less time-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: consuming while simultaneously making it more controlled
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and more comparable.
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 7. CONCLUSION
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space itemization

column2: We have found that structuring evaluation according to the
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: three tiers described above improves the selection of metrics
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and interpretation of results. While the essence of our approach
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: is domain independent, it does guide the adaptation of metrics
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to specific applications. First, the three tiers impose a structure
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: that selects certain metrics to constitute a broad pragmatic
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: assessment with minimal data, refining the subject of evalua-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion. Second, the three tiers organize metrics so that user
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: satisfaction and mission metrics have clear normative semantics
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: (results interpreted as good/bad) and they reveal the impact of
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: low-level metrics (results tied to particular components which
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: may be faulted/lauded). Finally, improvements in selection and
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: interpretation balance satisfaction, effectiveness, and perform-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen column-bottom

column2: ance, thus imbuing the evaluation process with focus toward
column3: page=4 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower

column2: utility for practical applications of spoken language dialogue.
column3: page=4 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 8. ACKNOWLEDGEMENT
